logic

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.GameBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class models a game board.
    Author:
    Andrei Letavin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameBoard()
      Creates a new game board filled with regular tiles.
      GameBoard(Tile[][] gameBoard)
      Creates a new game board based on a two dimensional array of tiles.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canMove(int row, int column, int newRow, int newColumn)
      Given a starting row and column and an ending row and column (called newRow and newColumn), this method determines if the move is possible.
      Tile[][] getGameBoard()
      Returns the two dimensional tile array used to represent the board internally.
      Tile getTile(int row, int column)
      Returns the tile at the given row and column indexes.
      java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getValidMoves(int row, int column)
      Given a row and column containing a piece, all of the valid moves are returned in an ArrayList<Tile>.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Start and initialize a new GameBoard.
      Piece move(int row, int column, int newRow, int newColumn)
      Given a starting row and column and an ending row and column (called newRow and newColumn), this method moves the piece found at the starting position if possible.

      Sets the game board to the passed in two dimensional array after validation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(Tile[][] gameBoard)
        Creates a new game board based on a two dimensional array of tiles. If the array is found not to be valid, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - A two dimensional tile array that represents the game board. If not found to be valid, an exception is thrown.

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()
        Creates a new game board filled with regular tiles.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameBoard

        public Tile[][] getGameBoard()
        Returns the two dimensional tile array used to represent the board internally.
        Returns:
        The two dimensional tile representation (Tile[][]).

      • setGameBoard

        public void setGameBoard(Tile[][] gameBoard)
        Sets the game board to the passed in two dimensional array after validation.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - A two dimension array representation of the game board.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int row,
                    int column)
        Returns the tile at the given row and column indexes.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0)
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0)
        Returns:
        The Tile at the given indexes.

      • getValidMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getValidMoves(int row,
                                               int column)
        Given a row and column containing a piece, all of the valid moves are returned in an ArrayList<Tile>.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0)
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0)
        Returns:
        All of the tiles the piece at the row and column parameters can move to. If there is no piece on the tile or no valid move, null is returned.

      • validateGameBoard

        public boolean validateGameBoard()
        This method validates the _gameBoard field by calling validateGameBoard
        Returns:
        true if _gameBoard is valid and false otherwise.

      • validateGameBoard

        public static boolean validateGameBoard(Tile[][] gameBoard)
        This method validates the passed in variable gameBoard. A game board cannot be have more rows than ConstantValues.ROWS and more columns than constantValues.COLUMNS. Every element of the Tile[][] must also have a value (it cannot be null).
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - The game board being validated.
        Returns:
        true if gameBoard is valid and false otherwise.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int row,
                       int column,
                       int newRow,
                       int newColumn)
        Given a starting row and column and an ending row and column (called newRow and newColumn), this method determines if the move is possible.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newRow - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newColumn - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        Returns:
        true if the move can be made, false otherwise.

      • move

        public Piece move(int row,
                  int column,
                  int newRow,
                  int newColumn)
        Given a starting row and column and an ending row and column (called newRow and newColumn), this method moves the piece found at the starting position if possible.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newRow - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newColumn - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        Returns:
        The the piece previously on the tile. If there was no piece on the tile, null is returned.
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - If an invalid move is purposed, an exception is thrown.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start and initialize a new GameBoard.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments to use with this GameBoard, they are not used.
